page.title: 05ST PETER'S CHURCH (2)
page.content: The angel on the right is holding an olive branch. In the middle window is Jesus crowned as King. Underneath is the Lamb of God. There is also a flag of St George. At the top there is a hand letting go of a dove. Some people who have worked at St Peter's Church have their names in stained glass windows in memory of them. The organ was built by Griffin and Stroud. It was built in 1898 and restored some time later by George Osmond and Co. It has two manuals. The altar was in the Lady Chapel origanaly in the Chancel so a new alter was built for the Chancel. The vestry is where the Choir gets changed and there is another room called the sacristy where the vicar gets changed into his robes.
